verses.verse: It happened, <S%H6256><s%> at the time of the return <S%H8666><s%> of the year, <S%H8141><s%> at the time <S%H6256><s%> when kings <S%H4428><s%> go out, <S%H3318><s%> that Joab <S%H3097><s%> led forth <S%H5090><s%> the <S%H2428><s%> army, <S%H6635><s%> and wasted <S%H7843><s%> the country <S%H776><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon, <S%H5983><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> and besieged <S%H6696><s%> Rabbah. <S%H7237><s%> But David <S%H1732><s%> stayed <S%H3427><s%> at Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> Joab <S%H3097><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> Rabbah, <S%H7237><s%> and overthrew it. <S%H2040><s%>

David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the crown <S%H5850><s%> of their king <S%H4428><s%> from off his head, <S%H7218><s%> and found <S%H4672><s%> it to weigh <S%H4948><s%> a talent <S%H3603><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> and there were precious <S%H3368><s%> stones <S%H68><s%> in it; <S%H1732><s%> and it was set on David's head: <S%H7218><s%> and he brought <S%H3318><s%> forth the spoil <S%H7998><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> exceeding <S%H3966><s%> much. <S%H7235><s%>

He brought forth <S%H3318><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> who were therein, <S%H7787><s%> and cut them with saws, <S%H4050><s%> and with iron <S%H1270><s%> picks, <S%H2757><s%> and with axes. <S%H4050><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> so to all the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon. <S%H5983><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> and all the people <S%H5971><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> to Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

It happened after this, <S%H310><s%> that there arose <S%H5975><s%> war <S%H4421><s%> at Gezer <S%H1507><s%> with the Philistines: <S%H6430><s%> then <S%H227><s%> Sibbecai <S%H5444><s%> the Hushathite <S%H2843><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> Sippai, <S%H5598><s%> of the sons <S%H3211><s%> of the giant; <S%H7497><s%> and they were subdued. <S%H3665><s%>

There was again war <S%H4421><s%> with the Philistines; <S%H6430><s%> and Elhanan <S%H445><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jair <S%H3265><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> Lahmi <S%H3902><s%> the brother <S%H251><s%> of Goliath <S%H1555><s%> the Gittite, <S%H1663><s%> the staff <S%H6086><s%> of whose spear <S%H2595><s%> was like a weaver <S%H707><s%>'s beam. <S%H4500><s%>

There was again war <S%H4421><s%> at Gath, <S%H1661><s%> where there was a man <S%H376><s%> of great stature, <S%H4060><s%> whose fingers <S%H676><s%> and toes <S%H676><s%> were twenty <S%H6242><s%> - four, <S%H702><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> on each hand, <S%H8337><s%> and six on each foot; <S%H3205><s%> and he also was born to the giant. <S%H7497><s%>
When he defied <S%H2778><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Shimea <S%H8092><s%> David <S%H1732><s%>'s brother <S%H251><s%> killed him. <S%H5221><s%>

These <S%H411><s%> were born <S%H3205><s%> to the giant <S%H7497><s%> in Gath; <S%H1661><s%> and they fell <S%H5307><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of David, <S%H1732><s%> and by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants. <S%H5650><s%>
